result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

JusticePoint discharge summary received and filed.

Defendant Michael Evans in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Michael Evans in custody.  Ericka Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Judge Kremers is hearing this case for Judge Havas, who is in trial.
As to count 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing proceeded.
.
As to count 2:
   Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement by: 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 days at the House of Correction with 9 days credit.
Court found the defendant indigent and waived all costs and surcharges.
Jury trial date of 05/11/2016 vacated.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Branch 45 in trial.  Case spun to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Michael Evans not in court, in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea and bail/bond hearing date.  Case adjourned to Br 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Michael Evans not in court, in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Defense has no objection to joining this case with 16CM619.  Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint status update received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: 3/21/2016 new arrest.  Defendant is in custody.  Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date of 3-30-2016.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Kenarius B

Defendant Michael Evans in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Michael Evans in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 45.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for scheduling conference.  Defense counsel reports that the defendant is facing new charges.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Court amends conditions of bail to include random urine screens and increased appointments with Justice Point.  Case remains calendared for Scheduling Conference on 3-22-2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 45.
